meta.name: Send pre-meeting Slack briefings using Google Calendar, Notion, GitHub, and Jira

nodes.name: Get Jira Issues Related to Meeting
Merge Jira Tickets and Github PR
Get User Slack Info from Email
Send Meeting Context in Slack DM
Prepare PRs and Jira Ticket List

parameters.content:
## The Trigger

- Triggers when a new Google Calendar event is created  
- Captures essential meeting details (title, start time, attendees)  
- Formats the event data for downstream processing

## Previous Meeting Context 

- Automatically pulls notes from the latest past meeting saved in Notion
- Ensures only meetings that happened **before the current one** are considered 
- Cleans and organizes the information so itâ€™s clear, consistent, and ready to use in the workflow

## Meeting Preparation Timing

This step makes sure the context is prepared at the right moment by:

- Setting a variable which consist reminder time **15 minutes before the meeting starts**
- Waiting until the correct time to continue the workflow
- Extracting key words from the meeting title to understand what the meeting is about

## Find Relevant Pull Requests

This step gathers development work related to the meeting by:

- Fetching recent pull requests from the connected GitHub repository  
- Filtering only the pull requests that are relevant to the current meeting topic

## Find Relevant Jira Tickets

This step brings in task and issue context for the meeting by:

- Fetching Jira tickets related to the meeting topic  
- Ensuring only relevant work items are included in the meeting summary

## Prepare Meeting Work Items

This section builds the meeting agenda by:

- Combining relevant GitHub pull requests and Jira tickets
- Organizing them into a structured list for sharing

## Prepare and Send Slack Messages

This section prepares the meeting context message and delivers it to all attendees:

- Builds a structured Slack message containing meeting details, topics, and previous notes  
- Aligns the message with the attendee list from the calendar event  
- Splits attendees into individual recipients so each person can be messaged separately

## Send Meeting Context via Slack DM

This step ensures the meeting context is delivered directly to each attendee on Slack:

- Looks up the Slack user using the attendeeâ€™s email address  
- Verifies whether a matching Slack user exists  
- Sends the meeting context as a direct message to the user if found  
- Safely skips sending if no Slack user is available for the email

# ðŸ§  Pre-Meeting Context Automation

## How it works
This workflow automatically prepares and sends relevant meeting context to attendees before a scheduled Google Calendar meeting.
When a new meeting is created in Google Calendar, the workflow captures the event details such as the meeting title, start time, and attendees. It then checks Notion to find notes from the most recent previous meeting, ensuring continuity and context.
Next, the workflow waits until 15 minutes before the meeting starts. At that time, it extracts keywords from the meeting title and uses them to find relevant GitHub pull requests and Jira issues related to the meeting topic. These items are combined into a single, clean list.
A well-formatted Slack message is then built, containing:
* The meeting name and time
* Relevant GitHub PRs and Jira tickets
* Notes from the previous meeting

Finally, the workflow looks up each attendee on Slack using their email address and sends the meeting context as a direct message. If a Slack user is not found, the workflow safely skips that attendee and continues without failing.

## Setup steps
1. Connect your Google Calendar account to detect newly created meetings
2. Connect Notion and select the database that stores meeting notes
3. Connect your GitHub account and choose the repository to scan for PRs
4. Connect Jira and ensure JQL access for fetching related issues
5. Connect your Slack account with permission to look up users and send DMs
6. Verify attendee emails in Calendar match their Slack email addresses
7. Activate the workflow and create a new calendar meeting to test
